label: 牛王杖
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Goō zue (J.) 牛王杖, also written 牛黄杖, sometimes referred to as 加持杖 kaji zue. Staff used by the leading officiant and 14 assistant monks in the kaji kōzui at the Latter Seven-Day Rite and in the 修正会 shushō'e rite.
